alert.note: Alert for Webster (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 6:23AM CDT until March 30 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT FOR EASTERN WEBSTER COUNTY... At 623 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Niangua to near Marshfield to Diggins, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Marshfield... Niangua... Diggins... Rader... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 101 and 109. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for southwestern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
